gameNet_cloneable
Class GamePlayer

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      gameNet_cloneable.GamePlayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable
public class GamePlayer
extends java.lang.Thread
implements java.io.Serializable

The GamePlayer class manages the socket connection with the GameControl.

When the GUI wants to send a message to the GameControl, the sendMessage routine is called to write the message object to an ObjectOutputStream.

When the GameControl wants to send a message to the GUI, the GamePlayer Thread will read the object from the ObjectInputStream. The GamePlayer class passes it along to the GUI by calling the receivedMessage method.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

getPlayerName

public java.lang.String getPlayerName()
getPlayerName returns the name of the player associated with this connection.

setGameConnectionBroken

public void setGameConnectionBroken(GameNet_ConnectionBrokenInterface gcb)
If you want your GUI to find out when a GameControl connection is broken, your GUI must implement the Interface_ConnectionBroken interface. Use setGameConnectionBroken to let GamePlayer know about this interface.

Parameters:
gcb - - an instance of the Interface_ConnectionBroken interface to be called when the Socket disconnects.

run

public void run()
The Thread that is underneath the GamePlayer class is responsible for reading the ObjectOutputStream from the GameControl. Every MyGameOutput read from the ObjectOutputStream is passed on by calling the receivedMessage routine. Your Networked Game should not be accessing the run routine directly. It has to be public to properly run as a thread.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

GameIsAlive

public boolean GameIsAlive()
GameIsAlive can be called to find out if the GamePlayer socket is still connected.

Returns:
true if socket is still alive

doneWithGame

public void doneWithGame()

sendMessage

public void sendMessage(java.lang.Object objectToSend)
sendMessage provides a way to send an object to the GameControl.

Parameters:
objectToSend - to pass to the GameControl.
